title: improve oc.dialogs appearance
body:
see the end of #2758.

thoughts from my side:
* general appearance:
 * make all "meta"-stuff (buttons, title-bar) smaller, so the content becomes more important
 * make it look more "slick" â€¦ atm it looks very clonky, squary, uncool (oh tastes :d)
 * make the title-bar smaller, to free space for content (like some window managers).
 * same for the buttons (or their padding), much wasted space.
 * dynamically pick width of the dialog, up to 4/9*body (the static width now). short messages get the full width, leaving much space unused again.
* alert():
 * make it more obvious it's an alert (atm alert and info only distinguish in the little icon on the left)
  * â†’ color the title bar red?
* filepicker():
 * make the top-dropdown .slidedown() (?)
 * make the user able to type a path in the top-bar (on .dblclick() maybe?) autocompletion would be needed for that
 * give the â†‘ a better appearance, maybe remake it into a back button so it's easier to understand (with â†? :d)
 * maybe make manual mimetype-selecting possible (could give filepicker() an argument with a list of mimetypes. the user can choose then from a dropdown at the bottom)
 * mimick os filepickers (taking an example from kdialog, see screenshot)

@tanghus you said you have some code/css for this?
